alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 11:28AM EDT until April 01 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Monroe County in southeastern Michigan... Southwestern Wayne County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 1215 PM EDT. * At 1128 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Carleton, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Romulus and Grosse Ile around 1140 AM EDT. Taylor and Trenton around 1145 AM EDT. Wyandotte around 1150 AM EDT. Dearborn around 1155 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Newport, Brownstown Township, Melvindale, Gibraltar, South Rockwood, Riverview, Rockwood, Willow, Ecorse and Allen Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
